plugins.name: FeedLabs
plugins.description:
The FeedLabs plugin helps you to quickly turn spreadsheets/csv files/feeds into beautiful creatives. Check out https://feedlabs.io for more!


How to

1) Create a template (frame), using Figma

2) Upload a CSV file with your items, using the plugin

3) Render the frame for all items in a few seconds


Features

  • Dynamic images; use image URLs to show a different image per item
  • Dynamic text; use fields inside text elements to show different text per item. (e.g. ${{price}},-)
  • Conditional rendering; show an element depending on a certain condition (e.g. 'sale' EQUAL true)
  • Render up to 50 items in a few seconds
  • Make infinite templates and designs, using Figma


FAQ

What is the pricing model?

The plugin in the current state will always be available for free.


What if I want to add more than 50 items?

This plugin is a free service and only allows limited features. However, we offer a service allowing processing of 100.000s of items in seconds, check out https://feedlabs.io for more!


Something is not working as expected, what do I do?

We love feedback! Please send an email to vanamerongen@squaremoon.nl and I will personally help you.


I need a feature which is not implemented, what do I do?

We are currently working very hard implementing many new features. However, if you have some useful suggestions, please send the to me at vanamerongen@squaremoon.nl.




Powered by SquareMoon B.V.
plugins.tagline: Turn spreadsheets into creatives with this creative automation plugin

plugins.name: Art Director Toolkit
plugins.description:
Efficiently crank out designs and decks like a Bawse by automating tedious tasks like grid layouts, item distribution, block layouts, randomizing objects, and text cleanup.


Watch the tutorial videos here for a quick primer on the tools.


Auto Grid Layout Tool:

Crank out mood boards by laying out items in a variety of grid formats:

  • Basic Grid: Equal subdivision based on number of columns
  • Columns: Masonry grid layout based on columns. Column heights are adjusted to fit within margins.
  • Rows: Masonry grid layout based on rows. Row widths are adjusted to fit within margins.
  • Random: Interlocking grid layout. Seeded randomness creates predictable variations.
  • Auto Columns: Intelligently creates a column based grid while maintaining visual order of items.
  • Auto Rows: Intelligently creates a row based grid while maintaining visual order of items.


Distribute Tool:

Intelligently distribute items within the selection bounds with a desired gap. You can choose to have items maintain their size ratios and scale up/down to create the desired spacing. Or they can all resize to have an equal width/height with a desired spacing in between


Blockify Tool:

Blockify your selection with a single click either vertically or horizontally. The tool automatically detects the order of elements. The tool also intelligently scales text to fit the block based on the visual outlines of the text vs white space borders in the text.


Swap Fills:

Quickly swap the fills of two selected elements. If more than two elements are selected, the tool randomly swaps the fills among the selection.


Randomizer:

Add randomness to items based on position, rotation and scale. Set the min and max values for precise control. Seeded randomness creates predictable patterns.


Text Tools:

Text cleanup quickly removes extra spaces from a text block.

Make Single Para will remove any paragraph breaks from the selected text and turn everything into a single paragraph.


Color Hashtags:

Quickly add a desired color to all hashtags within the selected text/text blocks.


Send feature requests, bug reports, and suggestions to artdirectortoolkit@gmail.com
plugins.tagline: Automate tedious design and layout tasks.

plugins.name: Variables Toolkit: Find, Swap and Bind Variables
plugins.description:
This plugin helps designers manage and swap Figma variables across different files and libraries. It allows you to:

  1. Search for variables used in your design, whether in selected elements, the current page, or across the entire file
  2. Easily switch variables from one collection to another
  3. Maintain variable modes (like Light/Dark theme settings) when swapping between collections
  4. Keep track of the swap progress with a visual progress bar
  5. Get a clear summary of how many variables were swapped, including any that were skipped or encountered errors
  6. Bind text variables to text layers in your selection.

This is particularly useful when:

  1. Updating designs to use a new library of variables
  2. Auditing which variables are being used in your designs
  3. Ensuring consistency across different files and libraries
  4. Applying your translation variables to the text


The plugin handles all the complexity of variable management behind the scenes, making it simple to maintain and update your design system variables.
plugins.tagline: Swap variables between collections. Find variables. Bind text variables.

130665.name: Variables Toolkit: Find, Swap and Bind Variables
130665.description:
This plugin helps designers manage and swap Figma variables across different files and libraries. It allows you to:

  1. Search for variables used in your design, whether in selected elements, the current page, or across the entire file
  2. Easily switch variables from one collection to another
  3. Maintain variable modes (like Light/Dark theme settings) when swapping between collections
  4. Keep track of the swap progress with a visual progress bar
  5. Get a clear summary of how many variables were swapped, including any that were skipped or encountered errors
  6. Bind text variables to text layers in your selection.

This is particularly useful when:

  1. Updating designs to use a new library of variables
  2. Auditing which variables are being used in your designs
  3. Ensuring consistency across different files and libraries
  4. Applying your translation variables to the text


The plugin handles all the complexity of variable management behind the scenes, making it simple to maintain and update your design system variables.
130665.release_notes:
BIND.
Improved the automatic text variables binding.
Previously, the plugin matched text against the variable name, which caused issues when text in languages like Arabic was detached — it couldn’t be reassigned (since our variables are in English for example).
Now, the plugin compares text with the variable values instead of names, making it possible to correctly reassign even multilingual text.
130665.tagline: Swap variables between collections. Find variables. Bind text variables.

plugins.name: Pomodoro Timer
plugins.description:
The Pomodoro Timer is an awesome Figma plugin that helps you stay focused and motivated while working on your designs. Whether you're a professional designer, developer, or just someone who wants to increase productivity, the Pomodoro Timer is the perfect tool to help you stay on track.


This plugin uses the Pomodoro technique to divide your work into focused intervals of 25 minutes, followed by short breaks of 5 minutes. You can also choose longer breaks of 15 minutes after completing a certain number of pomodoros.


The Pomodoro Timer is super easy to use! Simply install the plugin, select the duration of the timer, and start working. You'll be amazed at how much more focused and productive you can be with this simple tool.
plugins.tagline: Boost design productivity with Pomodoro Timer plugin for Figma.

plugins.name: Roller Coaster
plugins.description:
Prototype in FigJam? Now you can!


The maker of Tour Guide brings you Roller Coaster: A unique plugin that allows you to create simple clickable prototypes in FigJam and Figma by using connector arrows. It's simple!


  1. Create some objects.
  2. Connect them with FigJam connector arrows (copy and paste them from FigJam for use in Figma).
  3. Start the plugin!


When you turn on Roller Coaster, selecting a connected object will act as a 'click' that will 'transport you' to its next destination. This is great for walking through a flow. More instructions on how to use are included in the plugin.


Note: Nested objects require additional clicks to trigger the navigation.


If you've ever wanted to present a connector flow in FigJam or Figma, give this plugin a try!

accepted.name: Nelson Taruc
accepted.description: My design philosophy: Focus. Boost signal, kill noise. Solve the first problem. Embrace uncertainty.

plugins.name: Transparency
plugins.description:
Transparency 是一个轻量化的图像处理工具，可以让您通过选择图片中的某个颜色，将所有与之相似的颜色像素自动变为透明！对于多种颜色去除，重复运行插件操作即可。无论是设计复杂图案还是优化图片细节，这款插件都能助您一臂之力！


功能亮点:

  1. 点击吸取图片中的任意颜色。
  2. 自动检测所有与目标颜色相似的像素。
  3. 将相似像素转换为透明，轻松移除不需要的部分。
  4. 界面自适应图片比例，直观操作更简单。
  5. 支持高效的批量像素处理，优化设计流程。


适用场景:

  1. 移除图片背景。
  2. 精准修改颜色区域。
  3. 制作透明效果或蒙版。


投喂开发者~

buymeacoffee.com/tokamak


Transparency is a lightweight image processing tool that allows you to select a color in an image and automatically make all pixels with similar colors transparent! For the removal of multiple colors, simply run the plugin operation repeatedly. Whether you're designing intricate patterns or fine-tuning image details, this plugin is here to help you achieve your creative vision.


Key Features:

Pick any color in an image with a single click.

Automatically detect all pixels similar to the target color.

Transform similar pixels into transparency, easily removing unwanted parts.

Adaptive UI that matches the image's aspect ratio for intuitive operation.

Supports efficient batch pixel processing to streamline your workflow.


Use Cases:

Remove image backgrounds effortlessly.

Precisely edit specific color regions.

Create transparency effects or masks with ease.


Wanna buy me a coffee?

buymeacoffee.com/tokamak
plugins.tagline: Effortlessly transform similar colors into transparency—refine your designs with precision!

plugins.name: Foldwrap Banner Generator
plugins.description:
Foldwrap allows you to instantly generate HTML5 animations from your Figma design.


You can animate not just a single frame, but a bunch of them at once, making it possible to animate a complete storyboard, for example an animated banner, in 1 click.


Features

  1. Instantly turn static Figma designs into animated banner ads
  2. Animate entire storyboard to deliver marketing message frame by frame
  3. Choose animation style and fine-tune individual elements
  4. Export banners in native HTML5, ready for ad networks
  5. Switch between animated and static HTML output
  6. Generate and export multiple banners at once
  7. Export into readable HTML+CSS and use code as you want
  8. Scale creatives using data from Google Sheets


How to use the plugin

  1. Select one or more frames in Figma
  2. Run the plugin and press the 'Import' button
  3. That's it! ✨


If you are using your own font, you may need to upload it on Foldwrap website to make the result look as intended.


Possible incorrect results with complex shapes, filters, nested instances - simplify design in such cases.


We have a FAQ and more detailed description on a webpage

Feel free to contact creator directly if you have any questions.
plugins.tagline: Animate Storyboards and Banners in 1 click

plugins.name: Aspect Ratio
plugins.description:
Aspect Ratio is a Figma plugin that lets you quickly resize frames to fit both popular and custom aspect ratios. Whether you’re working with standard ratios like 16:9 or 4:3, or you need a specific custom ratio, Aspect Ratio has you covered.


How to Use It:

  1. Select a Frame: Begin by selecting any frame in your Figma workspace that you want to resize.
  2. Open the Plugin: Launch the Aspect Ratio plugin from your Figma plugins menu.
  3. Choose an Aspect Ratio:

↳ Predefined Ratios: Click on one of the predefined aspect ratio buttons to instantly apply that ratio to your selected frame.

↳ Custom Ratio: If you need a specific ratio, simply enter your desired width-to-height ratio in the custom ratio field, and it will be applied immediately.

4.Automatic Resizing: The plugin automatically resizes the selected frame based on the aspect ratio you choose, whether it’s a predefined or custom ratio, with no need for additional confirmation.

accepted.name: Nahuel del Valle
accepted.description: UX/UI designer oriented on visual design & design systems.

plugins.tagline: Select any frame in Figma and instantly resize it to popular or custom aspect ratios.

plugins.name: NeedsDesign for Pivotal Tracker
plugins.description:
Sync with Pivotal Tracker! Keep up with your product's backlog with mindful modularity.

💡Mindful Modularity:

Unburden yourself from the idea of having to build and maintain a monolithic prototype. They should be cheap, disposable, and serve only as a communication tool to validate user stories.

NeedsDesign:

Maintain focus on solving only the problem you currently have. NeedsDesign provides an opinionated workflow by displaying user stories that have a "needs design" label and creates a new page for each. Whether a feature or a bug, NeedsDesign helps to reinforce modularity in the design process and avoid the siren's song that is a single prototype that maintains parity with working software.

plugins.name: TODO comments
plugins.description:
TODO Comments is a powerful Figma plugin designed to streamline your design workflow by transforming comments into actionable tasks. With TODO Comments, you can effortlessly manage and keep track of all your tasks directly within your Figma file.


Key Features:


•Automatic Task Generation: The plugin scans your Figma file for comments starting with “TODO” and generates a comprehensive task list.

•Task Management: Easily mark tasks as resolved, respond to comments, and manage your workflow efficiently.

•User Assignment: Assign tasks to yourself or other team members by mentioning them in the comment using the format TODO @username: Task description.

•Categorized Lists: Tasks are categorized by assignment, allowing you to quickly see which tasks are unassigned, assigned to you, or assigned to others.


How to Use:


  1. Install the Plugin: Add TODO Comments to your Figma plugins.
  2. Add Your Credentials: Enter your fileKey and access token to enable the plugin to access and manage your comments.
  3. Add TODO Comments: Simply start any comment with “TODO” in your Figma file to create a task.
  4. Assign Tasks: Mention a team member in the comment to assign the task to them. For example, TODO @Marcos: Change this button.
  5. Manage Tasks: Open the TODO Comments plugin to view, manage, and resolve tasks.

accepted.name: Marcos Moreira
accepted.description: UI designer / developer

plugins.tagline: Tturns comments in Figma into a task list. Mark tasks as resolved, respond, and assign users!

plugins.name: Composables to Code
plugins.description:
Quickly export a node hierarchy as composables with a customizable mapping for your design system.


This plugin isn't focused on generating pixel-perfect code that mirrors everything Figma offers.

Instead, it's designed to save you from the repetitive task of constantly writing Column, Row, Text, ...,

and renaming components or variables to match your design system in code.


Currently Supported Features


  1. solid colors on texts, borders and backgrounds
  2. simple texts with one styling
  3. Row, Column, Box, Text, and FlowRow nodes
  4. box nodes as a fallback for icons or images
  5. baseline alignment of texts
  6. weight(1f) modifier on child nodes of Row or Column
  7. fixed sizing modifiers
  8. mapping of local variables (only paddings)
  9. mapping of text and color styles
  10. retain the original name of the nodes as a comment


Bugs or Feature Requests?


You can either leave a comment

or write an email to hey@letsprescribe.company.

If you encounter any bug, please attach a *.fig file as a reference.


Source: https://github.com/lets-prescribe/composables-to-code

accepted.description: Designer

plugins.name: Design Token Dock / 样式导出工具
plugins.description:
online pages


Description

This is a plugin to export figma style to design token json.


本插件用于将 figma 中定义的样式导出为 design token json.


How to use

Just select nodes using custom style then click export. And U will get a pretty json.


You can find more usage here.


Exports token to...

  • clipboard
  • json file
  • github pull request [new!]


Github Pull Request

To export token to github pr:

  1. Go to 'setting' and fill the github access token.
  2. Select styles.
  3. click 'Make a PR' button.
  4. config repo
  5. click 'Create PR' button.


Notice:

  • Your github access token need to have the access to create PR on master.


Feedback & Ideas

You can find me either at:

  • Github issues
  • qiuyifeng1997@outlook.com

plugins.name: Figma assets to Github plugin
plugins.description:
Description

This plugin adds the ability to export figma assets (icons, illustrations, etc) to a github repository through a pull request.


Using the plugin

Setup:

  1. Generate a personal access token in Github
  2. Inside the "Github" tab of the plugin, fill the details about the repository that will receive the exported assets and insert your personal access token
  3. Inside the "Assets" tab of the plugin, select the format the assets should be exported in (currently we only support exporting directly as SVG's or Vue Components)


Exporting:

  1. Click the export button
  2. Wait for the process to finish
  3. Check that a pull request was opened in the repository defined in "Github" tab


Read our documentation here.
plugins.tagline: A plugin that makes it simple to export assets from Figma to a Github repository.

117635.name: Figma assets to Github plugin
117635.description:
Description

Using the plugin

  3. Inside the "Assets" tab of the plugin, select the format the assets should be exported in (currently we only support exporting directly as SVG's or Vue Components)


Exporting:

  1. Click the export button
  2. Wait for the process to finish
  3. Check that a pull request was opened in the repository defined in "Github" tab


Read our documentation here.

networkAccess.reasoning: Uses the Github API to export the assets to a repository (creating blobs, trees, branch refs and pull requests).

117635.release_notes:
- [BREAKING] Adapted the plugin to export Component Sets (Assets selected must be ComponentSetNodes, with all the Component variants inside.)
- Added ability to add/replace prefixes and suffixes of asset names
117635.tagline: A plugin that makes it simple to export assets from Figma to a Github repository.

plugins.name: AI Image Maker (free)
plugins.description:
AI Image Maker is a Figma plugin that lets you instantly create up to 4 AI image generated images or graphics right from within Figma. No need to log into another service, add an API key, or anything else.


This is great for people who want to add some context to their designs before they share it with a client.


👋🏻 First things first:

  1. 100% free: no payment or fees required
  2. All AI images created can be used for personal and commercial projects


🥧 Incredibly easy to use:

  1. Super simple: just open up the plugin, enter your prompt, and click the "Create" button
  2. Choose to either create 1 or 4 images at once
  3. Browse through your previously created AI images to quickly insert one you made in an earlier design session


🤔 More:

  1. All AI images are added as the top most layer so you can easily find it
  2. All AI images are named with "🪄 AI Image Maker" at the beginning so they can easily be found / searched for


🛟 Feedback:

  1. We'd love any ideas or questions you have: feedback@berryplugins.com
  2. Leave a comment if you want to tell people how great this plugin is


🎉🎉🎉

accepted.name: Berry
accepted.description:
Question, idea or feedback? 
support@berryplugins.com

plugins.tagline: Create AI images in 10 seconds for your designs.

plugins.name: Ellipse to Rectangle
plugins.description:
Easily convert ellipses to rounded rectangles with this plugin.


How it works

The plugin changes ellipses to rounded rectangles, keeping all properties intact. It processes multiple shapes efficiently and ensures your design files remain clean and organized.


How to use

1. Run the plugin from the Quick Actions or Plugin menu.

2. Select the ellipses you want to convert.

3. The plugin will convert the selected ellipses to rounded rectangles.


The plugin only affects ellipses, leaving other shapes unchanged.
plugins.tagline: Change ellipse shapes to rectangles with same properties

plugins.name: Empty States: Perfect SVG Illustrations
plugins.description:
Empty States: Perfect SVG Illustrations


Empty States is your go-to Figma plugin for effortlessly finding and integrating free, beautifully crafted empty state illustrations in SVG format. Whether you're designing for onboarding, no-content pages, or error states, this plugin provides high-quality visuals at your fingertips, helping you communicate ideas and elevate your UI design.


Say goodbye to blank screens and hello to meaningful placeholders. With EmptyStates, adding personality to your product has never been easier.


👉 How to use EmptyStates:


  1. Open the plugin in Figma.
  2. Search for your desired empty state illustration.
  3. Insert the SVG directly into your design.
  4. Voilà! You've filled the void with style.

plugins.name: Statusup: Status management
plugins.description:
💫 Assign, Update and Monitor task and design statuses progress in Figma.


Statuses are added to the name of page, sections, frames, groups and components and updated when the plugin is restarted.


💥 Available:

  1. 20 statuses
  2. Quick commands
  3. Fast update status
  4. Multiselection layers
  5. List of active statuses (command "summary")


👋 Statuses:

  1. 🟢 › Done
  2. 🟠 › Blocked
  3. 🟡 › In Process
  4. 🔵 › In Development
  5. 🟣 › Need Review
  6. 🟤 › In Testing
  7. 🔴 › Cancel
  8. ⚪ › Archive
  9. ⚫ › Backlog
  10. 🏁 › Final
  11. 🛠️ › Draft
  12. 🗑 › Trash
  13. 💡 › Idea
  14. 🙅‍♂️ › No use
  15. ❗ › No delete
  16. ✅ › In Release
  17. 👁️› Reference
  18. 💠 › Ready to Dev
  19. 👀 › Moodboard;
  20. ✏️ › Design system;


This all speeds up the search for statuses, use the keyboard shortcut "Command + F" / "Ctrl + /" for quick searches.


How use?

You define and interpret the statuses of tasks and designs independently. To make it easier to use in a team, we recommend to describe the meaning of each status in the team wiki.


How I use it:

  1. {❗ › No delete} - For frames and sections that cannot be deleted
  2. {🙅‍♂️ › No use} - For components that cannot be used in layouts
  3. {🗑 › Trash} - Layouts to be deleted
  4. {🏁 › Final} - Final design stage
plugins.tagline: Assign, Update and Monitor task and design statuses progress in Figma
